name: Hearty Potato Soup with Bacon and Cheese
description: A rich and creamy potato soup loaded with bacon and cheddar cheese, garnished with green onions.
instructions: Cook Bacon: In a large pot, cook chopped bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon, set aside, leaving fat in the pot.
Saut√© Aromatics: Add diced onion to the pot, cook in bacon fat until translucent. Add minced garlic, cook 1 more minute.
Cook Potatoes: Add diced potatoes, stir for a few minutes. Pour in broth. Bring to boil, reduce heat, simmer until potatoes are tender (~20 min).
Blend (Optional): For smoother soup, use an immersion blender to blend to desired consistency.
Add Dairy & Cheese: Stir in heavy cream and butter (if not already blended in). Stir in shredded cheese until melted. Season with salt and pepper.
Finish & Serve: Stir half the cooked bacon back into the soup. Serve hot, garnished with remaining bacon, chopped green onions, and optional sour cream.
cookNotes: Blending the soup is optional; leave chunky if preferred.
For a lighter version, substitute heavy cream with milk.
Feel free to add other vegetables like carrots or celery with the onions.
Reheats well. Store leftovers refrigerated for up to 5 days.
